results.title: Hook
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Steven Spielberg filters J.M. Barrie’s ‘Peter Pan’ through a distinctly 90’s sensibility in ‘Hook’, a film of lost opportunities. Peter Pan has become Peter Banning (Robin Williams), a 40 year old lawyer with a permanent scowl on his face. Banning has lost all memory of being Peter Pan, and he is also in danger of losing his wife and children. When Peter and his family travel to London to visit Granny Wendy, Peter’s children are kidnapped by Captain Hook. As Peter recalls who he is and re-discovers his happy thoughts, he transforms into the Peter Pan of the past and goes to rescue his children. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Gerald Molen, Frank Marshall, Kathleen Kennedy and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: Lawrence of Arabia
results.creator_credit: David Lean, Sam Spiegel, Horizon (GB) and Columbia
results.brief_description: A sweeping, breathtaking epic covering the life of T. E. Lawrence who throughout his two years in Arabia during the First World War succeeded in uniting the Arab tribes against the Turks to become a legend in his own time, the great Lawrence of Arabia. Starring Peter O’Toole, Omar Sharif and Alec Guinness.

results.title: Hollow man
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Alan Marshall, Douglas Wick and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Scientist Sebastian Caine (Kevin Bacon) and his team have spent years trying to discover the formula to make matter invisible. When initial testing on a gorilla proves the developed serum works, Caine is pressured into testing it on a human candidate by his supervisor Dr. Kramer (William Devane), despite the formula being unstable. Rather than screen likely candidates, Caine decides to test the serum on himself. However, while the formula injected into the gorilla could be reversed, once Caine proves that his formula also works on humans his team are unable to reverse the process. Despite the team’s efforts to find a solution, Caine, unable to deal with his invisibility goes insane and begins to stalk his research team, in particular his ex-girlfriend Linda (Elisabeth Shue) and Matt (Josh Brolin), her new boyfriend. Director Paul Verhoeven uses computer-aided special effects in an amazingly realistic portrayal of invisibility in this sci-fi thriller which also stars Kim Dickens, Mary Jo Randle and Joey Slotnick.

results.title: The Bone collector [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Michael S. Bregman, Louis A. Stroller, Martin Bregman, Universal Pictures and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Jeffrey Deaver’s best selling novel, Officer Donaghy (Angelina Jolie) stumbles upon a bizarre murder scene. Her inexperience as a police officer bears no hindrance to the professional way she deals with the evidence, which catches the eye of paralyzed detective Lincoln Rhyme (Denzel Washington). Donaghy and Rhyme become embroiled in what eventuates as an incomprehensible slate of brutish murders where clues can only be unravelled in one place - the mind of the murderer. Cinematography by Dean Semler.

results.title: American psycho [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mary Harron, Edward Pressman and Columbia Tristar
results.brief_description: Patrick Bateman (Christian Bale) is a highly successful Wall street businessman. He is a prime example of the opulence that flourished during the excessive consumerism of the 1980’s. Everything has its place and there is a place for everything, everything that is except Patrick’s mental stability. Call it a nervous breakdown or psychosis, his soul is simply not there. Combining horror, suspense and extremely dry satire, “American Psycho” is a meditation on excess and the loss of personal identity. Considering the controversial nature of Bret Easton Ellis’s novel, director Mary Harron and co-script writer Guinevere Turner have transliterated the work with remarkable wit and insight. The film maintains the ambiguous balance between what may be a horrific reality or an elaborate fantasy of a desperately lost soul. Cast also includes Willem Dafoe, Jared Leto, Chloe Sevigny and Reese Witherspoon.

results.title: Flatliners
results.creator_credit: Joel Schumacher, Rick Bieber, Michael Douglas, Stonebridge Entertainment and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A group of medical students are determined to experience the afterlife by putting themselves in a near-death state and reviving themselves at the last minute. To literally “flatline”, shut down their hearts, just for a short time, to experience what it would be like to die. Problems arise when one of the students, Nelson Wright (Kiefer Sutherland), becomes obsessed with death and is determined to experience the afterlife before being revived. The screenplay was written by Peter Filardi who wrote the plot after hearing of a friend’s own near-death experience during an operation. ‘Flatliners’ was one of the most popular films of the early 90’s and was the first dramatic lead role for Julia Roberts. Cast also includes Kevin Bacon, Oliver Platt and William Baldwin.

results.title: The Quick and the dead
results.creator_credit: Sam Raimi, Patrick Markey, Allen Shapiro, Joshua Donin and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Ellen (Sharon Stone), a female gunslinger, arrives in the town of Redemption for a quick-draw contest. The contest has been the initiative of the town’s corrupt mayor, Herod (Gene Hackman), and attracts gunslingers from around the county, all with mysterious pasts. Ellen is seeking revenge on Herod for past injustices, the smooth talker known as ‘The Kid’ (Leonardo DiCaprio) may possibly be the mayor’s son, and the quiet Reverend Cort (Russell Crowe) refuses to participate despite being the fastest gun in town. As the contest continues all is revealed, leading to a final showdown between Ellen and Herod.

results.title: Ed TV
results.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Brian Grazer and Universal Studios
results.brief_description: Ed TV explores fame through the Big Brother phenomenon where ordinary people become famous just by allowing the nation to watch them 24/7. Ed (Matthew McConaughey) is chosen to be the star of the lastest real TV program. He agrees to allow cameras to film him 24 hours a day and broadcast this across the nation. After a shakey start the program takes off and Ed becomes the latest big thing. He initially enjoys his fame. But he starts to rethink his decision when the intrusive cameras potentially cause him to loose his new found love Shari(Jenna Elfman) and destory his family.

results.title: Baraka [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ron Fricke, Mark Magidson and Magidson Films
results.brief_description: Shot in 24 countries, “Baraka” is an extraordinary visual feast that examines the passionate and destructive love/hate relationship between humans and earth. A spectacular diversity of memorable images have been gathered from around the world from the natural and man-made environments, both past and present. The style is strongly reminiscent of the film “Koyaanisqatsi” in its use of timelapse photography juxtaposed with slower sequences, and the somewhat sentimental, simplistic portrayal of humanity.

results.title: The Craft
results.creator_credit: Andrew Fleming, Douglas Wick and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: Uprooted from her familiar surroundings and forced to move to Los Angeles with her father and stepmother, Sarah (Robin Tunney) is disappointed to find that she is again relegated to the role of the outsider at St. Benedict’s Academy. However, the main thing that sets her apart from the others - her magical ability - soon draws the attention of fellow misfits Nancy (Fairuza Balk), Bonnie (Neve Campbell) and Rochelle (Rachel True), who try to recruit her as the fourth member of their coven. Sarah is at first unwilling to enter their world of magic and ritual, afraid of her own untapped powers and sceptical of the others’ euphoric worship of the deity, Manon, but when her reputation is ruined after an encounter with the school’s most popular boy, Chris (Skeet Ulrich), she reconsiders. The four bind themselves into a formal coven one afternoon and cast their first spell as a group: Rochelle asks for revenge on a racist class-mate, Sarah asks that Chris fall in love with her, Bonnie asks for the severe burn scars that cover her body to be removed, and Nancy asks for all the power of Manon. Empowered by Sarah, a natural witch, their spells have the desired results, and the group becomes more close-knit as they continue their occult explorations. Feeling guilty about what she has done to Chris, Sarah seeks advice from the proprietor of the local occult shop, Lirio, who advises the group to be careful, as whatever they send out will return to them times three. The others ignore this advice and group leader Nancy soon becomes corrupted by the powers she is given after a midnight invocation on a stormy beach, resulting in the death of Chris. When Sarah suggests that the others practice more caution, they turn on her, tormenting her ceaselessly after she leaves their circle. Caught in a struggle between reality and illusion, Sarah is forced to invoke a greater power to help defend her against Nancy’s maliciously twisted magic. The soundtrack for this film features original music by composer Graeme Revell.
